data.title: 'Too Tall' Jones, Eddie George, former Vols announcing picks in Friday's NFL Draft
data.meta_description: Announcers for the second and third round picks were released Friday
data.text:
Tennessee State great Ed “Too Tall” Jones, former Tennessee Vols standouts Jamal Lewis and Al Wilson, Titans all-time rushing leader Eddie George and former Marshall County linebacker Don’t’a Hightower are among the individuals who will announce selections Friday in the second and third rounds of the 2019 NFL Draft.

The draft, which began Thursday with the first round, is taking place in downtown Nashville. The second round begins at 6 p.m.

Jones, the first player selected in the 1974 draft, was a three-time All-Pro defensive end (1981, 1982, 1983) for the Dallas Cowboys. He will announce the Cowboys' second round pick.

Lewis, a running back from Tennessee taken in the first round of the 2000 draft by Baltimore, will announce the Ravens’ second-round pick while Wilson, a linebacker from Jackson who was Denver’s first-round pick in 1999, will announce the Broncos’ second-round selection.

George, a first-round pick in 1996 who went on to rush for more than 10,000 career yards, will announce the Titans' second-round pick. Current Titans defensive end Jurrell Casey will announce Tennessee’s third-round pick.

Hightower, who was taken by New England in the first round in 2012, will announce the Patriots’ second-round pick.

Other notable former players announcing picks in the second or third round include Jim Brown (Cleveland); Billy Sims (Detroit); Terrell Owens (San Francisco), who played at Chattanooga; and Trent Dilfer (Tampa Bay), the new coach at Lipscomb Academy.

Here is the complete list:

Second Round

Arizona Cardinals, Karlos Dansby

Atlanta Falcons, Keith Brooking

Baltimore Ravens, Jamal Lewis

Buffalo Bills, Eric Wood

Carolina Panthers, Jon Beason

Chicago Bears, Charles Tillman

Cincinnati Bengals, Willie Anderson
